result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Child Sexual Exploitation - Produce, Perform, etc.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan K Schlipp

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

[MK] case called at 10:17am 
Defendant Ryan K Schlipp in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  ADA Michael Witt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Van Wagner indicates there was a delay in discovery, however discovery has now been received; the Defense recently received a plea-offer.  Attorney Van Wagner requests scheduling later in December, to allow time to have a forensic expert make contact with the agents and examine the materials that were seized.
recess 10:20am 

NEXT:  Status Conference on December 15th at 2:00pm
Request denied (due to length of continuance)
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
ec: DA and Atty Van Wagner (9/29/22--ma)
draft order for agreed continuance of 9.29.22 status
Stipulation for Continuance of 9.29.22 Status Conf
Status conference on September 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Case called at 2:30pm 
Defendant Ryan K Schlipp in court with Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr. Schlipp waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Upon agreement of parties, the Court amends 1st condtion of bond to read: 
--Mr. Schlipp cannot access any internet capable device with the exception that he may access such a device for communication directly with his legal counsel, and the exception that he may access such a device for purposes of seeking employment and, if that employment requires internet use, he may access the internet only for work purposes, and with the exception that he may access such a device for legal income generation at his self-employment 

recess: 2:43pm  

NEXT:   Status Conference on 9/29/22 at 11:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

[MK] case called at 1:33pm. 
Defendant Ryan K Schlipp appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Christopher Van Wagner appears by Zoom video-conferencing.  ADA Michael Witt appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Van Wagner agrees that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by the Defense.  ADA Witt agrees to the scheduling of a pretrial conference and status conference as proposed by Attorney Van Wagner.  

The Court requires a $2,500 Cash Bond with conditions:  
--Mr. Schlipp cannot access any internet capable device with the exception that he may access such a device for communication directly with his legal counsel, and the exception that he may access such a device in connection with employment at the Veterans Administration and with the exception that he may access such a device for legal income generation at his self-employment 
--Mr. Schlipp cannot use any public internet source;  the internet connection at his residence must be on a paid internet provider plan; the internet connection used at his workplace must be the employers internet
--Mr. Schlipp is to have no contact with minors, with the exception that he can have contact with his biological children and with his step-child who lives in the family residence.  Incidental contact with minors is not prohibited except where one would have reasonable fore-knowledge of the presence of minors; however Mr. Schlipp may attend religious events.   

recess 1:54pm for Mr. Schlipp and Attorney Van Wagner to meet in a Zoom break-out room. 
reconvene 2:00pm 
Scheduling is briefly discussed by the Court and counsel. 
recess 2:01pm
[Post hearing: the Court directs the clerk to strike the Court's reference, within the conditions of bond, to the definition of a device capable of accessing the internet] 

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on July 6th at 10:00am.   (2) Status Conference on July 18th at 2:30pm --JA note in comments that the case is at prelim stage
